Package srg.ship

Interface Damageable

All Known Implementing Classes:
CargoHold, NavigationRoom, Room
public interface Damageable
Classes which implement Damageable are capable of experiencing damage. Damageable objects have a health stat which can take damage and be repaired.
Version:
1.2

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    DAMAGE_RATE
    The rate at which damage occurs to a Damageable object is determined by the DAMAGE_RATE and some feature of the object's class.
    static final int
    HEALTH_MULTIPLIER
    The maximum health of a Damageable object is determined by the MAX_HEALTH_MULTIPLIER and some feature of the object's class.
    static final int
    REPAIR_THRESHOLD
    The threshold at which a Damageable object must be repaired.

    Sets the damage rate of a Damageable object to newDamageRate

  • Field Details

    • REPAIR_THRESHOLD

      static final int REPAIR_THRESHOLD
      The threshold at which a Damageable object must be repaired. Required value: 30
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • HEALTH_MULTIPLIER

      static final int HEALTH_MULTIPLIER
      The maximum health of a Damageable object is determined by the MAX_HEALTH_MULTIPLIER and some feature of the object's class. Required value: 5
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • DAMAGE_RATE

      static final int DAMAGE_RATE
      The rate at which damage occurs to a Damageable object is determined by the DAMAGE_RATE and some feature of the object's class. Required value: 5
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • getHealth

      int getHealth()
      Get the health as an integer percentage of the maximum.
      Returns:
      An integer representing the current health as a percentage of the maximum, rounded down.

    • needsRepair

      default boolean needsRepair()
      Returns whether the current object needs repair. If the percentage health (rounded-down) is less than or equal to 30% then repair is needed, or further use of the item will lead to damage.
      Returns:
      True if getHealth() is less than or equal to 30%.

    • damage

      void damage()
      Applies damage to the Damageable object at the appropriate rate.

    • isBroken

      default boolean isBroken()
      Return whether the current object is non-functional.
      Returns:
      true if health is less than or equal to 0, or false otherwise.

    • resetHealth

      void resetHealth()
      Recalculates maximum health and resets health to maximum.

    • setDamageRate

      void setDamageRate(int newDamageRate)
      Sets the damage rate of a Damageable object to newDamageRate
      Parameters:
      newDamageRate - The new damage rate.
